description.narrative: Relevant Government agencies adequately equipped to generate, collect and analyse disaggregated data from an equity and gender perspective, which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Equitable Access To Quality Education, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Government and other actors monitor child rights and contribute to evidence-based equitable State policy formulation, programming and budgeting.

THE INSTITUTE OF EDUCATION OF THE REPUBLIC OF AZERBAIJAN

related-activity.ref: 0310/A0/05/882 2. CRM AND PARTNERSHIPS FOR CHILD RIGHTS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Relevant Government agencies adequately equipped to generate, collect and analyse disaggregated data from an equity and genderperspective

description.narrative: The decision-making process of Government agencies related to the COVID-19 pandemic was supported with periodic high-frequency data and analytical work conducted by the UNICEF Country Office. The Government’s awareness on the importance of data disaggregation, on the current situation of the disaggregated data for SDGs, and on the role the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey in supporting the disaggregation process, was enhanced through active engagement of UNICEF in the Assessment of SDG Monitoring and Reporting Mechanisms in Azerbaijan and organization of an international conference on Data Disaggregation for SDGs in Azerbaijan. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2021
